section.title: The Call-Blocking Service
section.para: The Mobicents Call-Blocking Service, upon receiving an INVITE request, checks to see whether the sender's address is a blocked contact. If so, it returns a FORBIDDEN reply; otherwise, call setup proceeds as normal.

note.title: Blocked Contacts Cannot Currently Be Configured
note.para: Blocked contacts are currently hard-coded addresses. This model is evolving towards the eventual use of a database.

section.title: The Call-Blocking Service: Installing, Configuring and Running

varlistentry.term: Either an MSS for JBoss or an MSS for Tomcat Installation

listitem.para: The Call-Blocking Service requires either an MSS for JBoss or an MSS for Tomcat binary installation.
You can find detailed instructions on installing MSS for JBoss here: .
You can find detailed instructions on installing MSS for Tomcat here: .

formalpara.title: Downloading
formalpara.para: The Call-Blocking Service is comprised of two archive files, a Web Archive (WAR) and a Data Archive (DAR), which you need to add to your installed SIP Servlets Server. For more information about WAR and DAR files, refer to the JBoss Application Server Administration and Development Guide.

section.para: Download the Call-Blocking Service's WAR file from here: .
Download the Call-Blocking Service's DAR file from here: .

formalpara.title: Installing
formalpara.para: Both the call-blocking-1.1.war WAR file and the call-blocking-servlet-dar.properties DAR file that you downloaded should be placed into different directories in your SIP Servlet Server installation hierachy. Which directory depends on whether you are using the Call-Blocking Service with MSS for JBoss or with MSS for Tomcat:

listitem.para: Place call-blocking-1.1.war into the JBOSS_HOME/server/default/deploy/ directory, and call-blocking-servlet-dar.properties into the JBOSS_HOME/server/default/conf/dars/ directory.
Place call-blocking-servlet-dar.properties into the CATALINA_HOME/webapps/ directory, and call-blocking-servlet-dar.properties into the CATALINA_HOME/conf/dars/ directory.

formalpara.title: Configuring
formalpara.para: The darConfigurationFileLocation attribute of the Service element must be set to the value conf/dars/call-blocking-servlet-dar.properties. The instructions for doing so are given below by SIP Servlets Server type:

listitem.para: Open the JBOSS_HOME/server/default/deploy/jboss-web.deployer/server.xml configuration file and find the Service element. Add an attribute to it called darConfigurationFileLocation, and set it to conf/dars/call-blocking-servlet-dar.properties:

example.title: Editing MSS for JBoss's server.xml for the Call-Blocking Service

listitem.para: Make sure that the configuration file only contains one darConfigurationFileLocation attribute: your new one.

Open the CATALINA_HOME/conf/server.xml configuration file and find the Service element. Add an attribute to it called darConfigurationFileLocation, and set it to conf/dars/call-blocking-servlet-dar.properties:

example.title: Editing MSS for Tomcat's server.xml for the Call-Blocking Service

listitem.para: Make sure that the configuration file only contains one darConfigurationFileLocation attribute: your new one.

formalpara.title: Running
formalpara.para: Once the WAR and DAR files have been placed in the right directories, and the JBoss Application Server or Tomcat Servlet Container knows where to find them (which you specified in a server.xml file), then you should go ahead and run SIP Servlets Server.

formalpara.title: Testing
formalpara.para: The following procedure shows how to test the Call-Blocking Service.

step.para: Start a SIP softphone of your choice. The account name should be blocked-sender. The From Header should list one of the following addresses: sip:blocked-sender@sip-servlets.com or sip:blocked-sender@127.0.0.1. The SIP softphone does not need to be registered.
Make a call to any address, and you should receive a FORBIDDEN response.

formalpara.title: Uninstalling
formalpara.para: Unless disk space is at a premium, there is usually no need to uninstall the Call-Blocking Service. However, if you will not be using it again, you may want to unset or reset the darConfigurationFileLocation attribute of the Service element, which you set in the server.xml configuration file in .

section.para: You may also wish to delete the WAR and DAR files for the Call-Blocking Service, which you installed in .
